channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A Florida flea market feels the strain as immigration enforcement intensifies
item.description: A flea market is Florida is feeling the effects of immigration enforcement as it's lost at least 30% of its customers.
item.content:encoded: A flea market is Florida is feeling the effects of immigration enforcement as it's lost at least 30% of its customers.
item.dc:creator: Nancy Guan

item.title: A woman left a journal at the overlook where her brother died. Then others wrote in it
item.description: Losing a loved one is something almost everyone can relate to. But sometimes the way we process our grief can be a light in the darkness for others.
item.content:encoded: Losing a loved one is something almost everyone can relate to. But sometimes the way we process our grief can be a light in the darkness for others.
item.dc:creator: Jason Fuller

item.title: Two years ago, California allowed courts to order people into mental health treatment
item.description: Two years ago, California launched an experiment that lets judges order people with psychotic illness into care. Some counties are emphasizing something else the law enabled: "relentless outreach."
item.content:encoded: Two years ago, California launched an experiment that lets judges order people with psychotic illness into care. Some counties are emphasizing something else the law enabled: "relentless outreach."
item.dc:creator: April Dembosky

item.title: Democrats criticize the deal some in their party negotiated to end the shutdown
item.description: Moderate Democrats made a political calculation to end the shutdown but try to keep health care in the spotlight.
item.content:encoded: Moderate Democrats made a political calculation to end the shutdown but try to keep health care in the spotlight.
item.dc:creator: Deirdre Walsh

item.title: In the novel 'Lucky Seed,' the stakes are high for producing an heir
item.description: Author Justinian Huang talks with NPR's Ailsa Chang about his new book Lucky Seed, about the Sun family's quest to ensure a male heir to their wealth.
item.content:encoded: Author Justinian Huang talks with NPR's Ailsa Chang about his new book Lucky Seed, about the Sun family's quest to ensure a male heir to their wealth.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: Hundreds of flights are cancelled as air traffic controllers work without pay
item.description: Hundreds of flights have been cancelled for safety during the shutdown as air traffic controllers continue to work without pay.
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of flights have been cancelled for safety during the shutdown as air traffic controllers continue to work without pay.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel J. Sánchez

item.title: 'Strega Nona' is still reaching audiences at 50 years old
item.description: An award-winning children's picture book, Strega Nona by Tomie dePaola, turns 50. The story about a grandma witch with her magically full pot of pasta still finds new audiences — even on TikTok.
item.content:encoded: An award-winning children's picture book, Strega Nona by Tomie dePaola, turns 50. The story about a grandma witch with her magically full pot of pasta still finds new audiences — even on TikTok.
item.dc:creator: Alex Cipolle

item.title: What to know about Catherine Connolly, Ireland's new outspokenly left wing president
item.description: Ireland's new president is an outspoken left-winger, whose landslide win shook the country's political establishment. NPR profiles Catherine Connolly, the republic's 10th head of state.
item.content:encoded: Ireland's new president is an outspoken left-winger, whose landslide win shook the country's political establishment. NPR profiles Catherine Connolly, the republic's 10th head of state.
item.dc:creator: Fatima Al-Kassab

item.title: John Cleary, one of 9 people wounded during 1970 Kent State protests, has died
item.description: John Cleary, who was one of 9 people wounded during protests at Kent State in May of 1970, has died at the age of 74.
item.content:encoded: John Cleary, who was one of 9 people wounded during protests at Kent State in May of 1970, has died at the age of 74.
item.dc:creator: Kira Wakeam

item.title: Carlson's War: A veteran's story
item.description: Veterans Correspondent Quil Lawrence had been interviewing Iraq vet Dave Carlson for 10 years. His journey from war to prison to redemption is the subject of the podcast Carlson's War, excerpted here.
item.content:encoded: Veterans Correspondent Quil Lawrence had been interviewing Iraq vet Dave Carlson for 10 years. His journey from war to prison to redemption is the subject of the podcast Carlson's War, excerpted here.
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence
